text:
POEMS nr ENGLISH - No. 6
H.D. (Hilda Doolittle)
"OREAD"
Whirl up, sea —
whirl your pointed pines,
splash your great pines
on our rocks
hurl your green over us,
cover us with your pools of fir*
X* A BRIEF PARAPHRASE
An oread’s simple yet passionate expression of enjoyment at hearing and
seeing green sea water Breaking on a rocky shore.

Here: to wet, cover with water*
Ex: The passing car splashed water on me.

Ex: The wind whirled the kite higher and
higher.

Ex: The fallen leaves whirled up to
